body.name: NUVADERMIS Clear Silicone Scar Tape for Surgical Scars - 120" x 1.5" Roll - Extra Long Scar Sheets for C-Section, Tummy Tuck, Keloid, and Surgical Scars - Reusable Medical Grade Silicone Scar Tape
body.couponInfo: Save an extra 5% on your first Subscribe and Save order.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 15 hrs 4 mins
features: Advanced Silicone Scar Treatment: Manage old and new closed scars of various types, including hypertrophic, post-acne, keloid, post-surgery, and c-section with our silicone scar tape.

Medical Grade-Scar Tape: Made of premium medical grade silicone, this tape helps to reduce the appearance of both old and scars by helping to improve both color and texture of the scar while also smoothing and softening the skin. Wear for at least 6 weeks for new scars and 4 months for old scars.

Easy to Use: Soft, lightweight, and breathable silicone sheets for scars can be worn comfortably for 24 hours and do not leave any residue. Simply cut the tape to fit your scar, and apply to your skin. You’ll forget you’re even wearing it!
Quality Matters: Nuvadermis provides an effective and non-invasive solution to improve the appearance of scars. Each roll of scar tape is made of high-quality materials and formulated by surgeons.
Third Party Tested: Safe and effective silicone scar tape developed to help with scarring and keloids. Manufactured under the highest hygienic standards and quality control

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Scar Sheets Scar Gel Scar Tape Urea Cream Acne Patches Application Scar Treatment Scar Treatment Scar Treatment Body Face Type Silicone (Sheets) Clear Gel Silicone (Tape) Cream (Lotion) Hydrocolloid Patches Scent Unscented Unscented Unscented Unscented Tea Tree Oil Easy To Use & Fast Acting ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Cruelty-Free ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Directions Place a single sheet over the scar area, and wear it for a minimum of 8-12 hours daily for optimal results. Dispense a pea-sized quantity of gel or enough to apply a thin, even layer over the scar. Gently massage the gel into the scar twice a day. Trim the tape to the required length to effectively cover the scar area. For best results, wear it for at least 8-12 hours daily. Apply up to 3-4 times daily or as needed. Stick on clean skin and wear for 12 hours. reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my wife's scar after her arm surgery on December 6th. We started using in on or around January 6th and by January 28th her scar is so much better it is amazing after only 3 weeks. This tape sticks super well as we have only replaced it because we needed to, never because it has started to become loose or pull away. Even after 5 or 6 days of continually wearing this tape in the bath, shower, to bed, with clothes, doing regular daily activites and going to physical therapy this tape has never once started to come loose. I am very glad that I spendt the extra few dollars and bought this rather than trying to save a few bucks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best thing ever!
reviews.reviewText: This stuff is awesome! Stays on like glue, but comes off so gentle! Water proof and sturdy. I have a physical job and this thing did not budge!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to Use and good non-irritating Adhesion
reviews.reviewText: I have only been using this product for 7 days on my lower abdomen and breast area, so I won't know the overall results for some time. I was 5-weeks out from my surgery when i started using the product.The adhesion is good and it is not painful when i remove. Thus far, the strips are staying in place without any issues. I do remove when I workout or shower because i don't want it to lose the adhesion properties. It has been very easy to use and to store the stripe when i temporarily take remove for shower.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works surprisingly well
reviews.reviewText: I had a Total knee replacement and a big ugly scar. I have been using this scar tape and the scar has really faded a lot. It's a little difficult to use at first but I reuse the same strip for a week so it's very economical.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't stay put

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love This Silcone Tape
reviews.reviewText: This silcone tape is smooth on my surgery area. Definitely will order again. It is highly recommend by my doctor and surgeon. I had a knee replacement and the scar is more flesh tone and flat, not raised as it was before I used the tape.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Product as described, easy to apply and truly reusable.
reviews.reviewText: This product is as described. It's a roll so you can cut as you see fit. The way the adhesive and the backing were designed for easy to apply. It stays in place, is easy to clean, and is reusable.It is easy to peel off and doesn't hurt the skin.I highly recommend this product for scar treatment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This tape is phenomenal. I put it on a 6 week old scar on my arm and within a week of daily use it had diminished the scar drastically in both redness and raised/lumpiness. 10 stars from me!!

I’ve only been using this product for about a week so can’t speak for its long term results. However, silicone is the only ingredient proven to be beneficial in aiding in diminishing the appearance of scars so I’m confident it will help.I never thought I’d get more than 3 days per strip of this stuff but I’m actually on day 6 right now! I put it on Sunday night. Monday night I just took it off, (be careful if it’s a new scar and still tender) set it aside to shower and just stuck it back on when the area was dry. Tuesday, same thing. Wednesday, I noticed it seemed to have a couple of small particles on it so I took a bit of mild soap (just squeezed it onto my finger and applied it directly to the strip) and gently rubbed it up and down the strip. Then I rinsed it (containing to rub it under the water) using lukewarm water then laid it sticky side up over a towel. When I got out of the shower it still had some water particles on it so I just blew them off and it was like new again. Thursday night I realized when I was in the shower that I had forgotten to even take it off! Seemed fine though so I just left it on until the next night. Friday night it wasn’t quite as sticky anymore but after rubbing it a bit I managed to get it secured again. Tonight (Saturday) I’ll take it off and start with a new strip.I am EXTREMELY impressed. The roll is quite a bit longer than I was expecting and you can easily cut it to fit your needs so it will last a really long time providing you don’t have really big scars or many to use it on.How well it works for you would be dependent on many factors though. Where you put it of course will effect how many uses you might expect to get. Areas that move a lot probably would be better suited for a silicone gel treatment instead.Also, just your skin. Some people just have less sticky skin. I don’t get clammy and have never sweat a lot so I stay pretty dry throughout the day.Lastly, I got these for my breast augmentation scars and am still in the faze that I have to wear a supportive bra 24/7. The fact that I put these on and then put something over them that holds them in place, probably helps a lot as well.I agree with others, keep the plastic pieces to put the strips on when you take them off. I (of course) forgot so used cling wrap instead which worked well also.Hope this helps someone. Happy healing all :)

I bought this for over night use on a wicked hand scar. I have to wear a splint at night time on my hand and I put this inside on my scar overnight. Sticks really well and if it stops sticking, just run some water over it. I use a 4" long strip for about 7-8 nights. You can use them for longer, but I just like having a fresh piece every week. Great product and definitely helps keep the scar softer and contributes to the healing process.

Not reusable as it’ll fold like regular tape before you can put it back on but is if you successfully clean and put it back on before. Have not used it long to see results but so far its okay, does not do well with sweat and will immediately come off.
It is sticky and long lasting.

It’s frustrating that this product is advertised as reusable multiple times, but as others have also posted, it’s not. It loses stickiness after one use and I find that reusing it causes my skin to be irritated. I also have more irritation around my incisions if it’s kept on for more than 8-10 hours. Other brands of silicone tape I’ve used I can wear for 12-20 hours with no issues and reuse them many times. Not worth the cost to have a one time use tape.
